results.adx_keywords: Campaign Finance;United States Politics and Government;Political Action Committees
results.byline: By David A. Fahrenthold, Tiff Fehr and Charlie Smart
results.title: How to Raise $89 Million in Small Donations, and Make It Disappear
results.abstract: A group of conservative operatives using sophisticated robocalls raised millions of dollars from donors using pro-police and pro-veteran messages. But instead of using the money to promote issues and candidates, an analysis by The New York Times shows, nearly all the money went to pay the firms making the calls and the operatives themselves.

results.abstract: Brooklyn Seltzer Boys has a century-old carbonator and a museum with a spritzing station. Beat that, LaCroix.

results.title: What Do You Call 2,326 Kyles in One Place? A World Record.

results.title: He Told Followers to Starve to Meet Jesus. Why Did So Many Do It?
results.abstract: Hundreds were drawn to a remote wilderness in southeastern Kenya by the End Times preaching of pastor Paul Mackenzie. Relatives and ex-members tried to intervene, but some did not want to be rescued.

results.abstract: The Ukrainian president’s talks with the pope and Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni came at a potentially pivotal moment in the war with Russia, as Kyiv’s forces make advances near the key city of Bakhmut.

results.title: Chris Strachwitz, Who Dug Up the Roots of American Music, Dies at 91
results.abstract: Traveling the nation to discover little-known performers for the Arhoolie label, which he founded in 1960, he earned a nickname: El Fanático.

media.caption: Chris Strachwitz in 2010. Through his label, Arhoolie Records, he documented music that came not only from before the era of the music industry but even from before the existence of mass culture itself.

results.title: Why Ron DeSantis Is Limping to the Starting Line
results.abstract: Mr. DeSantis and his allies are retooling his expected run for the White House after a series of missteps and miscalculations allowed Donald J. Trump to define the 2024 Republican race.
